title: PSA: if you have an off meta jungler
body:
That is not a reason to refuse to leash.

That is not a reason to steal their first camp.

That is not a reason to spam the "?" ping on them when they are just trying to farm.

Doing these things does nothing but fuck up your teams early game and piss off your jungler.

Assisting the enemy is reportable, Zyra jungle is not.

replies.body: I jungle naut the most lately. And its technically "off meta" and no one bats an eye.
Nope, not off meta. It used to be a thing in seasons past.
Jungle Naut IS viable. Just that we now have a majority of sheeps who thinks he's only a Support just because "BUT LCS DOES IT HURR DURR DURR"
I used naut supp before LCS
everyone with a bit of curiosity did
And we were called trolls for doing that.....
Why wouldn't you anyways? 4 forms of CC and tanky AF.

But he brings very little damage. He's an unbelievably effective frontline disruptor for teamfights but he's also extremely team reliant. Also, slow clears.

And in the current meta people expect the jungler to be polyvalent and self sufficient ; and maybe also a bit broken.

> [{quoted}](name=Westonbirt,realm=EUW,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=lGvgEbAE,comment-id=00010001000100010000,timestamp=2016-02-16T15:50:11.652+0000)
>
> But he brings very little damage. 

A tank _shouldn't_ be bringing damage, but then again, this is League of Legends.
Funny enough, lane nautilus brings insane damage if you utilize his passive and auto attack reset properly.

> [{quoted}](name=BeatzBoyFTW,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=lGvgEbAE,comment-id=00010001,timestamp=2016-02-16T08:27:43.485+0000)
>
> Jungle Naut IS viable. Just that we now have a majority of sheeps who thinks he's only a Support just because "BUT LCS DOES IT HURR DURR DURR"

Funny thing is he's a top laner in the LCS now. All the LCS has proven to people with sense is that you can take Naut pretty much anywhere.
It also proves that we should stay open for other non common picks because each patch can bring something new to the table.
Lcs does Naut top and it's worked out very poorly.

He's been used as a top laner more than support this season in all pro leagues. Off Meta doesn't mean viable/not viable, just not favored in the current meta. I'm a Sej main with over 70% win rate, she's definitely off meta but if you really master any champ you can do well.

If you want to play a jungler that's reliant on a leash larger than 2-4 auto-attacks in solo-queue, 
here's a thought
just don't. 

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=O3wRS5to_Jo

Let me put it this way

Say you have an {{champion:32}} who started Q for an invade, but he missed and it got called off. Would you just leave him to try and take gromp with his only ability being Q?

Of course not.

That would be retarded.

Now, say you have a {{champion:53}} jungle who did the same thing. Would you leave him with no leash?  No.

Something else I have seen is someone stealing the first camp, denying level 2, just because they didn't like the jungle pick.

If you do that to a {{champion:76}} , she is fucked and YOU get called a troll.
If you do it to a {{champion:143}} , she is equally fucked but no one cares.

That said any jungler can clear 1st camp and buff and back then go straight to 2nd buff in those situations. No point in putting lanes behind just cuz you messed up. Especially in bot lane, that 1 minion lost is a good 5 seconds before they get their ult b4 the enemy.

Edit: Which leads to some devastating bot carnage.
Leashing most of the time shouldnt effect how much exp you get, if you leash correctly you should only AA 3-4 times and run straight back to lane immediately so you dont lose out on exp.

Maybe I misunderstood. The way I heard it was you guys started the leash late. Thus why I said "...cuz you messed up".

But you're just saying to leash in general? Didn't think people didn't do that so I didn't consider it.
Don't forget abilities. If you have an ability that can help clear it that will be off CD by the time you get to lane, for the love of god, use it.

> Say you have an {{champion:32}} who started Q for an invade, but he missed and it got called off. Would you just leave him to try and take gromp with his only ability being Q?
> 
> Of course not.

friends help each other out

amumu has no friends

therefore you are not obliged to help him
Here's an idea, don't use outdated information from a meta that doesn't exist anymore.
Meta has nothing to do with it. 5 autos is the maximum amount of time I can stay without losing a creep. I'm not getting behind on xp, so you're not getting a longer leash.

Meta has everything to do with it.
But hey, just keep losing game from winning lane when you get rekt by a built devourer ghostblade carry jungler that could have been stopped by anything that needs harder leashes.

_Jungler takes 5 more seconds to take gromp_

_**EVERYTHING SUDDENLY GOES TO SHIT AND YI IS INSTANTLY STACKED**_

So basically, duo top and take no jungler? Because nowadays 2-4 AAs barely counts as a leash.

Seriously, stay a while longer to leash. You might lose farm, but at least if your jungler gets invaded, he´ll be closer to full hp and might even be able to turn the invade around, thusly avoiding giving them a 400 gold lead on you.

The standard 4 auto leash is fine for every meta jungler. It's your own fault if you pick something that needs extra commitment from your team without asking them. 

And I don't just lose farm, I lose lane pressure and experience. I've lost lanes because I got to lane a few creeps behind.

>And I don't just lose farm, I lose lane pressure and experience. I've lost lanes because I got to lane a few creeps behind.

If you lost lane, it sure as hell wasn´t because you were behind on CS.

there's about 40% of toplane matchups where you will instantly lose the lane HARD if you miss 1 creep of XP in the first wave and your opponent doesnt, because he gets to level2 before you and then denies you the entire second minion wave of XP by zoning you, sometimes even reaching level 3 when you're still level1
Even if you would rather have a meta jungler than a offmeta, you should rather have a jungler with a leash. This isnt a tough question.

As much as I hate unorthodox picks, I would never screw over my jungler. WTF is wrong with you pissy players to pull off shit like that? They are your teammates.  If you dont' have your teammates back, then piss off. You can practically jungle with anyone in this season if you know how to do it. The team jeopardizing the jungler himself is guaranteeing he will abandon you in lane and you have no one to blame but yourselves.
Theyre just afraid of being challenged if the jungler actually does well. So no lesh. Then they dont have to worry about it doing well
Is the goal to win or be different?  Why jungle the equivalent of Teemo when there are far better options?

Because sometimes the off meta picks offer something unique to the team. I imagine that post 6 Teemo jg has unparalleled map control because his mushrooms let you know whenever the enemy jg tries to leave.
I try Teemo Jungle sometimes, and can confirm this.
the fact you consider jungle teemo to be bad makes your point invalid. It's just like kile147 said, jungle teemo brings incredible vision control
PSA: doing that shit to ANY Jungler will hurt them and in effect you unless you can carry your lane all game including fighting the enemy jungler. Have you seen Karthus Jungle? That crap is crazy.
I have a friend who now mains Karthus jungle... He ganks all the lanes at once...

I've pretty  much given up trying to convince people that jungle Zyra works really well. Sure there are a lot of other champions that are FOTM right now, but none of them have the AOE cc, burst, and zoning of Zyra jungle. 

The community is too negative about unusual picks. It's not about being a special snowflake, it's about having fun in this damn game for a change. Playing OP fotm shit bores me to death. 

I feel your pain OP. This game and its community are the shittiest it has been in a while. 

I personally can't wait for Overwatch. Have had nothing but fun times in beta.

http://36.media.tumblr.com/3b434ac802a41a901d9fb1e931c8e093/tumblr_o1w4hsohdg1tvmyy6o1_1280.png

here's my placement games with mostly zyra jungle.
Basically anything works in gold 4...

> [{quoted}](name=Skullchaos,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=lGvgEbAE,comment-id=00150004,timestamp=2016-02-17T02:56:17.839+0000)
>
> Basically anything works in gold 4...


http://na.op.gg/summoner/userName=melyn


Diamond Zyra main plays her jungle all the time, but yes it does also work in Gold 4.

This is Kinda a grey area for me, Cause i'm a jungle main. Like yea you still deserve a leash, but why are you playing zyra jungle in the first place. If you wanted an ap jungler you could have just went for someone like Ekko/Nidalee/Elise/Evelynn and be able to self leash.

eve still needs a leash in most cases, hell she is actually way worse at clearing than jungle zyra, and the ganks are slightly more in favor for zyra as well (bringing meaningful cc and good burst)
Eve cheats vision, but is so UP right now because of it I would much rather have someone like an Annie jungle (as a semi-jungle main) UNLESS you are an actual Evelynn main and know how to abuse her stealth

If you cant clear the first camp solo you shouldn't be jungling anyway. the ? pings are asking why your not doing jack shit or if the mid is conceeded and thinks he is suppose to ALWAYS have blue buff. If you did anything you wouldn't see them in the jungle while farming in the jungle. If you weren't bad them stealing the first camp wouldn't be an issue. Nobody is afraid of pissing of a zyra jungle because your not gonna do anything for 30-50 minutes anyway...except maybe die constantly.taking your jungle or pinging at you isn't assisting the enemy any more then picking zyra jungle.

Leash is needed even more Jg meta champs.

Two, good leash equals better or earlier ganks.

So be nice, think smart, help leash.
Jungle meta is actually super flexible right now. A majority of picks have great potential in the right hands.

PSA: don't be an ar*e with your team-mates, it won't make you win.

Not only true for your jungle.

People acting negatively and throwing you under the bus for playing unusual champions, is something which really just needs to stop. 

"OMG why'd you go AP {{champion:110}} mid lane.", before the jungle refuses to gank your lane. 
"WTF {{champion:90}} isn't AD you fucking idiot" , before you go 3/1/0 in lane.

What's really bad is when a team constantly attacks you for having lost lane or something as these unusual picks. I hate to break the news to you, but you don't win every lane, even on {{champion:238}}  the most {{champion:64}}  meta of {{champion:114}}  fucking meta {{champion:236}} champions, you {{champion:107}} narrow minded {{champion:103}} fucking twat {{champion:77}}
